title: Airlines Cancel More Than 1,000 Flights for 11th Straight Day
sub_head: U.S. sees its worst stretch of flight cancellations since the start of the pandemic
body:
Nearly 1,500 U.S. flights were canceled Wednesday, the 11th straight day of more than 1,000 cancellations, marking the airline industryâ€™s worst stretch since the start of the pandemic.
Airlines also delayed more than 1,700 flights by midday Wednesday, according to aviation data tracker FlightAware. Carriers have now canceled more than 21,000 flights since Christmas Eve.
